member.summary: Creates a new ViewHistoryItem object with the specified ViewState; the newly created object is then added to the ViewHistory collection. The adding of the new state to history can be cancelled in the HistoryItemAdding event.

The caption of the new history item.
The ViewState structure representig the state of C1PreviewPane control (scroll position, zooming etc).

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Preview.C1PreviewPane.AddCurrentViewStateToHistory(C1.Win.C1Preview.HistorySavedActionsEnum,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new ViewHistoryItem object with the current state of the preview pane; the newly created object is then added to the ViewHistory collection. The adding of the new state to history is cancelled if the Document property of the preview pane is null, or if the specified action is not saved according to the current value of the C1PreviewPane.HistoryOptions.SavedActions property. Also the adding of the new state can be cancelled in the HistoryItemAdding event handler.
member.param: The HistorySavedActionsEnum value defining the user action associated with the new history item.
The caption of the new history item.
If true, forces the adding of the current state even if it is equal to the state stored in the CurrentHistoryEntry.
member.returns: The newly created ViewHistoryItem object, or null if the action was cancelled.

member.summary: Gets or sets the current history entry. The value should be in the ViewHistory collection of this C1PreviewPane object, and can not be null. Note that in some situations the history entry can not be changed (e.g. when the operation is attempted while the preview is changing its state). In those cases the set will be ignored.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Preview.C1PreviewPane.PreviewScrollPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the location of the top left corner of the preview area (the scroll position) within the preview window. The value is relative to the PreviewRectangle, not to the ClientRectangle. The value is independent of the ZoomFactor (i.e. setting the same values will scroll to the same logical position in the document at any zoom factor).

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Preview.C1PreviewPane.LayoutSection
member.summary: Helper class providing a section inside which the preview layout is suspended. Should be used to enclose fragments of code where several properties on which the preview pages layout depends are changed. Layout updating is suspended between the construction and disposing of the class instance. Sample usage: using (LayoutSection ls = new LayoutSection(previewPane)) { ..code... }.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Preview.DocumentHandlerBase
member.summary: Describes an object used to interface between the preview and the different types of documents (C1Preview, .NET PrintDocument, C1Report's document, and so on). NOTE: this class can NOT use pane.Document, as that property is implemented via this class itself.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Preview.DocumentHandlerBase.RefreshPreview
member.summary: Refreshes the preview pages.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Preview.DocumentHandlerBase.Reflow
member.summary: Reflows the document using the current page settings.

member.summary: Sets the specified page margin of the document to the specified value.
member.param: Which margin to set.
The new margin value, in pixels.
member.returns: True if the document was changed, false otherwise.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Preview.DocumentHandlerBase.GetPageLayout(System.Int32,System.Drawing.SizeF@,System.Drawing.RectangleF@,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Retrieves the page layout info (page size, margins, header/footer heights). Done via the doc handler so that it can add some doc-level info (e.g. account for page margins common to all pages when calculating the content rect.
member.param: The preview page index.
Out: the totatl page ("paper") size.
Out: content rectangle inside the total page size.
Out: page header height.
Out: page footer height.

member.summary: Gets the type of document starage used to store the documents in history. The class shoud be descendant of VisitedDocumentStorage.
member.returns: The type of class.

member.summary: Stores the underlying document to the stream.
member.param: The stream object to store to.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Preview.DocumentHandlerBase.CreateVisitedDocumentStorage
member.summary: Creates the new VisitedDocumentStorage object and saves the content of underlying document into this storage.
member.returns: The created VisitedDocumentStorage object.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Preview.DocumentHandlerBase.BuildVisitedDocumentCaption(System.String@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Generates the caption for document added to the document's history. By default hasAutoDocumentCaption is true and documentCaption contains caption like "Document1".
member.param: OUT: The caption of document.
OUT: Should contains true if name was auto generated.

member.summary: Called by Dispose. Allows doc handlers to release resources.

member.summary: Gets the size of the preview page matrix (rows/cols).

member.summary: Tests whether there is a document page at the specified position in the pages' matrix.
member.param: The preview pane.
The coordinates of the page to test.
The size of the matrix.
member.returns: True if there is a page, false otherwise.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Preview.DocumentHandlerBase.GetPageBounds(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the page r, either for the full page or for the page sans the margins. If margins are not hidden, the bounding rectangle's location is always at (0,0).
member.param: The preview page index.
Indicates whether horizontal margins are hidden.
Indicates whether vertical margins are hidden.
member.returns: The page bounding rectangle.

member.returns: True if the page has been found, false otherwise.

member.summary: Converts document coordinates to preview pane client coords.

Point on the page.
Out: Preview pane client point.
member.returns: True if the client point belongs to a document page, false otherwise.

member.summary: State before any of the location-related properties is changed is saved in history.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Preview.HistorySavedActionsEnum.DocumentOpen
member.summary: State before a new document is opened is saved in history.
member.remarks: When triggered, this option saves the current document, and thus may cause delays and/or increase memory consumption, especially in the case of large documents.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Preview.HistorySavedActionsEnum.DocumentReflow
member.summary: State before reflow of the current document is saved in history.
member.remarks: When triggered, this option saves the current document, and thus may cause delays and/or increase memory consumption, especially in the case of large documents.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Preview.HistorySavedActionsEnum.DocumentChangeMargins
member.summary: State before margins on the current document are changed is saved in history.
member.remarks: When triggered, this option saves the current document, and thus may cause delays and/or increase memory consumption, especially in the case of large documents.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Preview.HistorySavedActionsEnum.DocumentChangePageSettings
member.summary: State before page settings on the current document are changed is saved in history.
member.remarks: When triggered, this option saves the current document, and thus may cause delays and/or increase memory consumption, especially in the case of large documents.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Preview.HistorySavedActionsEnum.DocumentAction
member.summary: State before any of the document-related changes occur is saved in history.
member.remarks: When triggered, all document-related actions save the current document, and thus may cause delays and/or increase memory consumption, especially in the case of large documents.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Preview.HistorySavedActionsEnum.DocumentChangedAction
member.summary: State before any of the document-related changes (except the opening of a new document) occur is saved in history.
member.remarks: When triggered, all document-related actions save the current document, and thus may cause delays and/or increase memory consumption, especially in the case of large documents.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Preview.HistorySavedActionsEnum.All
member.summary: State before any of the supported changes occur is saved in history.
member.remarks: Note that this option includes DocumentAction, which, when triggered, saves the current document, and thus may cause delays and/or increase memory consumption, especially in the case of large documents.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Preview.EmfPageMapElem
member.summary:
An EmfPageMap is built for a page when that page must be searched for text, or user is selecting text in it. EmfPageMap is a memory-heavy object, so should be used sparingly (i.e. only when needed, and disposed afterwards).
The map contains EmfPageMapElem elements, each corresponding to a record in the page metafile. Elements for 2 record types are supported: - string elements, used for text search/selection; - link elements, used for hyperlinks and the like.
All elements store their metafile rectangle.
String elements store the string and the char map.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Preview.PreviewPages.BeginChanges(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Begins a series of related changes to the pages collection, specifying the type of changes to occur. Should be followed by a call to EndChanges. Improves performance and provides consistency.
member.param: If true, the changes are assumed to be limited to adding new pages to the end of the list. Specifying this parameter as true may increase performance when creating long documents. Note: it is the caller's responsibility to ensure that if this parameter is true, the changes are indeed limited to appending new pages only. Otherwise, unpredictable results may occur.

member.summary: Displays the PageSetupDialog, for dialog must be specified: PageSettings PrinterSettings This method is a workaround for .NET bug with Margins in PageSetupDialog (the are displayed incorrectly if RegionInfo.CurrentRegion.IsMetric == true) and for PaperSize if it is created as PaperSize ps = new PaperSize(Name, Width, Height);
member.param: The PageSetupDialog object
member.returns: Returns the result of dialog.ShowDialog() function.
